title: Paul Merson warns Arsenal, Man Utd and Chelsea over Leicester’s top-four chances
text:
Paul Merson believes Leicester could make the ‘Big Six’ pay (Picture: Getty)

Paul Merson has warned the Premier League’s elite that Leicester are capable of sneaking into the top four this season, if they don’t get their acts together.

Ahead of the 2019/20 campaign it was expected that four of the ‘Big Six’ of Manchester City, Liverpool, Arsenal, Chelsea, Manchester United and Tottenham Hotspur would claim the four available Champions League spots, but Leicester’s start to the season has left them dreaming of breaking their stranglehold.

Brendan Rodgers’ side have only suffered league defeats to Manchester United and to Liverpool but they gained plenty of plaudits for their efforts in a 2-1 loss to Jurgen Klopp’s Reds, who needed a 95th minute penalty from James Milner to extend their winning streak to 17 matches.

Will Brendan Rodgers guide his team to the Champions League? (Picture: Getty)

Despite Saturday’s defeat at Anfield, Leicester remain third in the table after faltering starts from the rest of the expected Champions League chasers.

And while Manchester City and Liverpool seem set to claim two of the spots, Merson warned former club Arsenal as well as Manchester United, Spurs and Chelsea that Leicester can make them pay if they don’t buck up their ideas.

‘There is a big gulf. Leicester are doing well and they might get in the top six or the top four but there is still a gulf,’ Merson, told Sky Sports.

‘We didn’t expect Leicester to go to Anfield and win but from what I’ve seen, if the other teams fighting for the top four don’t show consistency this season which they are not at the moment, Leicester could sneak in.’
